com.example.lab3_restapi

Class FetchData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.lab3_restapi.FetchData

  • public final class FetchData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as the intermediary between the OpenWeather API and the app for handling requests.

    It uses the Geocoder library as well as the Volley library to extract more precise location from the user input and make requests to the API.

    It is intended to be used as a no-instance helper class (hence static methods) to actualize the weather data when needed.

      static java.util.List<android.location.Address> getCitySuggestions(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String city)
      Provide up to five matches from the Geocoder library for the location provided (useful if user misspells the name of the location for example).

    • Method Detail

      • fetchAPIData

        public static org.json.JSONObject fetchAPIData(android.content.Context context,
                                               java.lang.String city)
        Blocking method to request new forecast data from the API. Must be called from a thread to prevent stalling the flow of execution.
        Parameters:
        context - required for the Geocoder and Volley libraries
        city - the city for which to retrieve weather data
        Returns:
        The JSON response from the API.

      • getCityLocation

        public static LatLng getCityLocation(android.content.Context context,
                                     java.lang.String city)
        Lookup latitude and longitude coordinates for the location provided. Adapted from Steve Benett's answer.
        Parameters:
        context - required for the Geocoder library
        city - the location to lookup
        Returns:
        The geographic position of the closest match to the location provided.

      • getCitySuggestions

        public static java.util.List<android.location.Address> getCitySuggestions(android.content.Context context,
                                                                          java.lang.String city)
        Provide up to five matches from the Geocoder library for the location provided (useful if user misspells the name of the location for example).
        Parameters:
        context - required for the Geocoder library
        city - the location to lookup
        Returns:
        A list of up to 5 addresses matching the provided location.
